channel.title: Safety on HeaterTips
channel.description: Recent content in Safety on HeaterTips

item.title: Can I use an Extension Cord with a Space Heater?
item.description: You should only use heavy-duty extension cords with your space heater. A cheap extension cord easily overheats and risks fire.

item.title: 4 Best Child-Safe Heaters
item.description: The best child-safe heaters are Dyson Hot+Cool heaters, and, for babies, the Vornadobaby Tempa, with its lockable power switch.

item.title: Can Space Heaters explode?
item.description: Space heaters can't explode by design. There is no chamber where pressure can build up. Additionally, they use non-flammable materials.

item.title: Do Space Heaters Burn Oxygen?
item.description: Electric space heaters never burn oxygen. But fuel-burning space heaters such as propane heaters do burn oxygen.

item.title: Are Air Purifiers Safe for Pets? (Dogs, Cats, Birds, etc.)
item.description: Yes, air purifiers are generally safe for pets. However, ensure you’re using a HEPA air purifier. Never use an ionizer.

item.title: Can you use an Extension Cord with an Air Purifier?
item.description: Yes, you can use an extension cord with an air purifier. Extension cords support 13 Amps. More than the 2.5 Amps the strongest purifiers draw.

item.title: Can you run a Swamp Cooler without water?
item.description: Yes, you can run a swamp cooler without water. Once the water runs out, it becomes a simple fan. So, you still have a cooling effect.

item.title: What is the safest Propane Heater?
item.description: The Mr. Heater Big Buddy and Big Maxx models are the safest propane heaters by specification. However, real heater safety is up to you.

item.title: Are Mr. Heaters safe in a tent? (Fact checked)
item.description: Mr. Heater Buddy and Big Buddy heaters are only safe to use in >3-person tents. For smaller tents, you should get the Little Buddy heater.

item.title: Can you use a Gas Stove as a Heater?
item.description: Yes, you can use a gas stove as a heater. To do it safely, monitor the flame color (should be blue) and vent your room occasionally.

item.title: Can you put a Space Heater on a table?
item.description: Yes, you can put a space heater on a table. Space heaters radiate heat away from the tabletop, so there is no risk of fire.

item.title: Can Ventless Heaters cause Carbon Monoxide Poisoning?
item.description: Yes, you can theoretically get carbon monoxide poisoning from a ventless heater. However, it is unlikely if you vent your room regularly.

item.title: Are Propane Heaters safe indoors?
item.description: Yes, propane heaters are safe indoors! But propane heaters can emit enough heat to ignite household things (wood, curtains, carpets).

item.title: Can you use a Surge Protector with a Space Heater?
item.description: Yes, you can use a surge protector with your space heater. In the US, you can use a 15A surge protector with any space heater.

item.title: Are Infrared Heaters safe indoors?
item.description: Electric infrared heaters are safe to use indoors. Don’t place anything right in front of the heater, as the radiation can ignite it.

item.title: How long can you run a Dyson Heater?
item.description: You can run a Dyson heater 24/7 in your bedroom, living room, or kitchen. Dyson heaters don’t overheat when running them for long durations.

item.title: Can you run an Infrared Heater overnight?
item.description: Yes, you can run a quality infrared heater overnight given it is made of fireproof material and has built-in overheat protection.

item.title: Can Candles cause Carbon Monoxide Poisoning?
item.description: Yes, candles can cause carbon monoxide poisoning, but it’s highly unlikely. Candles produce too little CO to cause a poisoning.

item.title: Can you use an Oil-filled Radiator in an RV?
item.description: Yes, you can use an oil-filled radiator in an RV. You can run any oil-filled radiator off shore power, off a generator, or off the batteries.

item.title: Can you use an Oil-filled Radiator in a Bathroom?
item.description: Yes, you can use an oil-filled radiator in a bathroom. The large metal heating body is safe, even when water is splashed on it.

item.title: Can you burn Coal in a Wood Stove?
item.description: It is not recommended to burn coal in a wood stove. While it is possible, it is not efficient and can cause damage to your stove.

item.title: Can You Run a Wood Stove Pipe through a Window?
item.description: Yes, you can run a wood stove pipe through a window using double-walled metal pipes and a metal sheet to cover the window space.

item.title: Can you run two Portable ACs at once?
item.description: You can run two portable air conditioners at once on the same circuit if they do not draw current more than the amperage of the circuit.

item.title: Can you use a Space Heater for a Sauna?
item.description: Yes, you can use space heaters to heat a sauna. You have to use two electric space heaters simultaneously or one propane gas heater.

item.title: Can you use a Portable AC when it’s Smoky outside?
item.description: You should not use a single-hose portable AC when it’s smoky outside. However, you can use dual-hose portable ACs, window ACs and split ACs.

item.title: Can You Use a Propane Heater in an RV?
item.description: Yes, you can use a propane heater in an RV. The heater must be fully functional (ideally new) and its oxygen intake must be well-adjusted.

item.title: Can you Run Two Space Heaters at once? (Experiment Confirmed)
item.description: On 120V US outlets you can run two space heaters at once on reduced settings (&lt;80%). On 220V-240V outlets two heaters can run on full power

item.title: Do Space Heaters Emit Carbon Monoxide?
item.description: Electric space heaters never emit carbon monoxide. But fuel or gas-burning heaters can produce carbon monoxide if improperly adjusted.

item.title: Can Portable Air Conditioners Run 24/7?
item.description: Yes, portable air conditioners can run 24/7. It will result in an increase of your electricity bill by around $151.20 a month.

item.title: Are Portable Air Conditioners Safe?
item.description: Yes, portable air conditioners are safe to use as long as you maintain them properly and run them on moderate settings.

item.title: Do Portable Air Conditioners give off Carbon Monoxide?
item.description: Portable air conditioners do not give off carbon monoxide. ACs are fully sealed systems. No gas will ever leak unless the device is broken.

item.title: Can you use an Extension Cord with a Portable Air Conditioner?
item.description: Yes, you can use an extension cord with a portable air conditioner. Just make sure that your extension cord can handle the power of your AC.

item.title: What is the Safest Space Heater?
item.description: The DeLonghi oil-filled radiator is the safest space heater. It comes with built-in overheat protection, tip-over protection and a thermostat.

item.title: How long can you leave a Space Heater on?
item.description: You can leave any quality and modern space heater on 24h a day, as long as they have built-in overheat protection and a thermostat.

item.title: Can you put a Space Heater on Carpet?
item.description: Yes, you can put any regular household space heater on carpet. Exceptions are torpedo heaters which exhaust flames.

item.title: Are Dyson Heaters safe? (A Critical Review)
item.description: Yes, Dyson heaters are very safe due to their clever design which hides hot heating elements and the built-in fan inside the case.

item.title: Are Pelonis heaters safe? (A critical review)
item.description: Yes. Pelonis heaters are safe. They are as safe as other heater brands. The cheap price comes from cheaper production.

item.title: 5 Safety Tips for using a Space Heater in a Bathroom ﻿
item.description: Can you use a space heater in a bathroom? Here are 5 safety tips you should follow to make sure you run your space heater safely in your bathroom.

item.title: 5 Space Heaters you can leave unattended (Reliable & Safe)
item.description: Here's a list of 5 space reliable and safe space heaters you can leave unattended. They all have various safety features to avoid overheating other risks.

item.title: Are Space Heaters Safe for Cats?
item.description: Space heaters are not always safe for cats. In this article you'll find out exactly how you can make sure your cat is safe when you use a space heater.

item.title: Can you run a Space Heater off a Car Battery?
item.description: You can theoretically run a space heater off a car battery, but you shouldn't. Let me show you much better alternatives to keep warm without electricity.

item.title: Can you Plug a Space Heater into a Timer?
item.description: To find out whether you can plug your space heater into a timer you should check the power rating of your timer. Generally, most timers can handle heaters.

item.title: What Space Heaters are Safe for Birds?
item.description: Which space heaters should you use for birds? In this article you'll learn about what to consider and which space heaters to pick to keep your birds safe!
